question.title: How to add oss-license plugin to Android App
question.body:
How can I add the oss Licenser from Google to my Android app?

I have already implemented implementation(libs.play.services.oss.licences). However, every time I open the activity, the following error message appears

This App does not have any open source licences

This makes no sense at all, as my app definitely contains open source licenses. Do you know why this could be? As far as I have understood the instructions correctly, a plugin has to be added.

How exactly do I do this in the new build.gradle.kts? Link to Github: https://github.com/google/play-services-plugins/tree/main/oss-licenses-plugin

plugins {
    alias(libs.plugins.android.application)
}

    dependencies {
    
        implementation(libs.appcompat)
        implementation(libs.material)
        implementation(libs.activity)
        implementation(libs.constraintlayout)
        implementation(libs.preference)
        testImplementation(libs.junit)
        androidTestImplementation(libs.ext.junit)
        androidTestImplementation(libs.espresso.core)
    
    
        implementation(libs.play.services.oss.licenses)
        implementation (libs.lottie)
    }
